taskB.description: Perform antifreeze procedure (winterizing procedure in cold climate - under 5°C)

taskB.description: Perform periodic wash of the watermaker.

taskB.description: Reset the automatic hydraulic valve if the watermaker sucks air or experiences other problems.

taskB.description: Perform automatic washing of the system.

taskB.description: Fasten the watermaker with the provided L-brackets and ensure it is not suspended.

taskB.description: Press STOP to turn off the watermaker.

taskB.description: Check membranes for any signs of wear or damage during regular maintenance.

taskA.description: Calibrate the pump high pressure switch to ensure proper functioning.

taskB.description: Calibrate the pump high pressure switch using a screwdriver to ensure proper functioning.

taskB.description: Check the status of the watermaker using the remote panel.

taskB.description: Check filter cleanliness

taskB.description: Replace reverse osmosis membranes when they are old or if chemical washings do not improve water quality.

taskB.description: Perform final flushing of the watermaker.

taskA.description: Activate the start-up procedure through the function of the second page.

taskB.description: Activate the start-up procedure through the function of the second page.

taskA.description: Read the use and maintenance manual before installing the system.

taskB.description: Read the use and maintenance manual before installing the system.

taskA.description: Check the fresh water pressurizing pump of the boat is on.

taskB.description: Check the fresh water pressurizing pump of the boat is on before the start-up procedure.

taskB.description: Check for leaks

taskB.description: Perform the antifreeze procedure in cold climates by flushing the system and filling it with a propylene glycol and unchlorinated water solution.

taskA.description: Inspect the machine regularly to minimize the risk of fire hazards.

taskB.description: Inspect the machine regularly to minimize the risk of fire hazards.

taskB.description: Press START to turn on the watermaker.

taskB.description: Perform automatic washing of the system after stopping the watermaker.

taskB.description: Verify all components and hoses are connected correctly before start-up.

taskB.description: Check the plant working pressure

taskA.description: Start the watermaker with the by-pass activated.

taskB.description: Start the watermaker with the by-pass activated.

taskA.description: Check the seawater inlet valve and salt water drain valve (if existing) are open before the start-up procedure.

taskB.description: Check the seawater inlet valve and salt water drain valve (if existing) are open.

taskA.description: Regular inspection of the watermaker to minimize the risk of failure or other issues.

taskB.description: Regular inspection of the watermaker to minimize the risk of failure or other issues.

taskA.description: Replace the 5 micron filter regularly to ensure proper functioning of the watermaker.

taskB.description: Replace the 5 micron filter regularly to ensure proper functioning of the watermaker.

taskA.description: Check the electrical wiring and connections regularly to prevent electrical hazards.

taskB.description: Check the electrical wiring and connections regularly to prevent electrical hazards.

taskA.description: Leave the unit running for approx. 20 minutes, checking that the hoses are properly positioned.

taskB.description: Leave the unit running for approx. 20 minutes, checking that the hoses are properly positioned.

taskA.description: Perform regular maintenance as per the maintenance schedule provided in the manual.

taskB.description: Perform regular maintenance as per the maintenance schedule provided in the manual.

taskA.description: Use only recommended material for the installation (hoses, fittings, and seals).

taskB.description: Use only recommended material for the installation (hoses, fittings, and seals).

taskA.description: Activate automatic startup procedure after filter cartridge replacement or general service.

taskB.description: Perform automatic startup procedure after filter cartridge replacement or general service.

taskA.description: Perform adjustments as necessary

taskB.description: Perform adjustments as necessary

taskA.description: Clean the filter container thoroughly when changing the filter to prevent contamination.

taskB.description: Clean the filter container thoroughly when changing the filter to prevent particles from entering the machine.

taskA.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open.

taskB.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open.

taskA.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open.

taskB.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open before the start-up procedure.

taskA.description: Connect the manometer horizontally if the unit is installed horizontally.

taskB.description: Connect the manometer horizontally if the unit is installed horizontally.

taskA.description: Check the reset valve is closed and the positioner is completely unscrewed before the start-up procedure.

taskB.description: Check the reset valve is closed and the positioner is completely unscrewed.

taskA.description: Check the charge level of the accumulator to ensure correct functioning of the watermaker.

taskB.description: Check the charge level of the accumulator to ensure correct functioning of the watermaker.

taskA.description: Perform cleaning of membranes with SC1 product if clogged.

taskB.description: Perform cleaning of membranes with SC1 washing product if clogged.

taskA.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open.

taskB.description: Check the grey valve on the active carbon filter is open before the start-up procedure.

taskA.description: Install an additional 20 micron filter before the 5 micron filter if the watermaker is used in harsh conditions.

taskB.description: Install an additional 20 micron filter before the 5 micron filter if the watermaker is used in harsh conditions.

taskA.description: Purge air from the system

taskB.description: Purge air from the system

taskA.description: Check for leaks

taskB.description: Check for leaks

taskA.description: Install the watermaker above the pump, ensuring it lies completely on a flat surface.

taskB.description: Install the watermaker above the pump, ensuring it lies completely on a flat surface.

taskA.description: Perform manual wash of the watermaker.

taskB.description: Perform manual wash of the watermaker.

taskA.description: Perform the first start-up procedure when restarting the plant after a shutdown procedure.

taskB.description: Perform the first start-up procedure when restarting the plant after a shutdown procedure.

taskA.description: Install a backup treatment on board, such as a UV sterilizer or a microfiltration system.

taskB.description: Install a backup treatment on board, such as a UV sterilizer or a microfiltration system.
